task.title: List Test
task.shortdesc: Test on simple list, nested list, list in table.

taskbody.prereq: You need to do this first.
taskbody.context: The stage needs to be set just so.

substep.cmd: which is done by doing this

chrow.choption: Set the Path environment variable to include the directory where you installed the Ant bin directory.

ol.li: Find the Path environment variable in the list. If Path is not listed, click on New under the System variables section.
Type %ANT_HOME%\binIf there are other variables listed, create a new variable separated by a semicolon. Ensure there are no spaces before or after the semicolon.

new designed nested ol list.
li1
li2
nested
sub-li1
sub-li2

chrow.choption: Set the ANT_HOME_test environment variable to the directory where you installed Ant.

ol.li: Click on New New under the System variables section.
Type ANT_HOME in the variable name field.
Type C:\ant in the variable value field.

chrow.choption: Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to the directory where you installed the J2SE SDK application.

ol.li: Click on New under the System variables section.
Type JAVA_HOME in the variable name field.
Type C:\j2sdk1.4.2_08 in the variable value field.

chrow.choption: Set the JHHOME environment variable to the directory where you installed the JavaHelp application.

ol.li: Click on New under the System variables section.
Type JHHOME in the variable name field.
Type C:\javahelp\jh2.0\javahelp\bin in the variable value field.

chrow.choption: Set the CLASSPATH environment variable to include the .jar files from the Apache FOP application.

ol.li: Find the CLASSPATH environment variable in the list. If CLASSPATH is not listed, click on New under the System variables section.

Type C:\fop-0.20.5\build\fop.jar;C:\fop-0.20.5\lib\batik.jar;C:\fop-0.20.5\lib\avalon-framework-cvs-20020806.jarIf there are other variables listed, create new variable separated by a semicolon. Ensure there are no spaces before or after the semicolon.

chrow.choption: Set the CLASSPATH environment variable to include the directory where you installed Saxon.

ol.li: Find the CLASSPATH environment variable in the list. If CLASSPATH is not listed, click on New under the System variables section.
Type C:\saxon\saxon.jarIf there are other variables listed, create a new variable separated by a semicolon. Ensure there are no spaces before or after the semicolon.

taskbody.postreq: Now, you too can do this...
